fields.description: On occasion we fail to close sprints when we actually finish them, meaning we that we may leave a '1 week sprint' open for multiple weeks. There doesn't appear to be a method of closing a sprint with a manually-entered previous date. This leads to incorrect sprint velocities being computed as it appears that the sprint durations are longer than reality. It would be nice to have some control over this so that these situations can be rectified.
fields.summary: Request ability to close sprint with a manually-entered date
HyperJobs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*Pull request decline* and *Pull request merged* are delaying the workflow transition when performing the transition using those workflow triggers

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add *Pull request decline* or *Pull request merged* in one of the transition
# Perform *Pull request decline* or *Pull request merged* in Bitbucket by mentioning any JIRA Issue number/key

h3. Expected Behaviour
The transition will be automatically triggered

h3. Actual Behaviour
The transition is having a delay (10-20 minutes)

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround to expedite the transition process for this moment
fields.summary: Delay in workflow transition when performing it by using pull request merged and pull request decline trigger
As a Scrum user I can see a parent issue status displayed in the swimlane so that I can easily scan the taskboard

Please let me know when it's done and we can test :)

Brgds

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, any issues that is resolved in future sprint or backlog, will be removed from the board. This is because the resolved issues are considered as those which do not need to be worked on. However, there are cases where it was resolved by mistake. As JIRA Agile board removes it right away, the users often do not even noticed. This lead to having some issues missing off track. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have built-in filter (perhaps at the left side panel of the board) to show the issues that get resolved outside active sprint (future sprint or backlog) that user or scrum master can refer to, to see if there is any issues resolved by mistake. Scrum master can reopen the case if the issues need to worked on.
fields.summary: Having a built-in filter for issues resolved outside active sprint

fields.description:
By taking away the standard browser right-click menu I've lost the ability to "open in new window" and "open in new tab". Now I have to select the issue, wait for the right-pane to open (I prefer to not have the right-pane open :P ), then I have to right-click the JIRA# link to the this. A real pain. 

Can you please add "open in new window/tab" to the right-click menu?
fields.summary: the new custom right-click menu is frustrating

fields.description: It is too much work to click the "..." menu (or kb shortcut of ".") and then select "more actions", and type in "com" and select it just to add a comment. This is a regular actions and should be immediately in the "..." menu by "Log Work".
fields.summary: The "..." menu in the right-pane needs "Comment' option
User not able to view the Field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The following applies to issue types other than Epics:
* I do not have easy click-and drag linking for issue types other than Epics.
* I do not have a comprehensive count/overview within the Epics Panel of Boards for issue types other than Epics (Issues, Completed, “Status Bar” of completion).
* I do not have an EASY way to create “quick filters” based on the selection of a specific item (key). (It is not practical to create a ‘Quick Filter’ for every given key).
* I do not have a quick and consistent (user friendly) means of creating issues within another issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
The features offered by the Epics Panel allow for a solution to all 4 bullets above (SEE BELOW). Allowing for the selection of issue types when selecting ‘Epics panel’ from the Column management of Board Configurations will satisfy all three problems, while maximizing already developed JIRA functionality in an easy manner.  !image002.jpg.png|thumbnail!
I do not have easy click-and drag linking f !image001.png.png|thumbnail! or issue types other than Epics.
!image001.png|thumbnail!
I do not have a comprehensive count/overview within the Epics Panel of Boards for issue types other than Epics (Issues, Completed, “Status Bar” of completion).
!image002.png|thumbnail!
I do not have an EASY way to create “quick filters” based on the selection of a specific item (key). (It is not practical to create a ‘Quick Filter’ for every given key).
!image005.jpg.png|thumbnail!
I do not have a quick and consistent (user friendly) means of creating issues within another issue.
!image004.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Software interface and issue linking

We have the following queries:

2. Is JIRA 7.2 compatible with RHEL 7.3 ?

Also please let us know if there are any known issues or suggestions with JIRA 7.2 which we should take care of when doing the upgrade.

Thanks and Regards,
Kaushik Kakkad.

BMC Software

+91-9922999336
fields.summary: Need guidance to upgrade to Jira 7.2
Virtualise IT

fields.description:
The Scrum backlog has the ability to filter by versions and epics.

Kanplan has the identical ability to filter by versions, but lacks the ability to filter by epics, making it less capable than the Scrum board.

For many of the projects I work on, Kanplan would be ideal, except for this one *huge* missing piece.
fields.summary: As a PM I would like to filter by epics in kanplan backlog

fields.description: Frequently getting error in editing docs online: Users are experiencing issues while making any changes to online collaborated documents. If the user keeps saving the document every one 1 min, no issue is observed and If we leave it for 5 mins the user is unable to save the document. See the history of the documents.
fields.summary: Frequently getting error in editing docs online:

fields.description: WEV Dev Project
fields.summary: Web Dev

fields.description: Currently JIRA file attachment download functionality is only provided at the individual issue level. Using JQL or some sort of defined menu option, provide the ability to download all JIRA issue file attachments based at the same time for a specific project ID. In other words, I should be able to run a JQL query, or select a menu option, to return all attachments for a specific project ID and then be able to download all of those files at one time via a zip file or individual files into a local Downloads folder. There are plug-ins that do this but it would be a great feature if this was native functionality!
fields.summary: A user should be able to download all file attachments at the same time for multiple issues/stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15399].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Within JIRA, the current Development Panel will only list the number of Crucible reviews related to that issue in a single state (Open or Closed, etc).   However this will not give you the total number of reviews related to that issue directly on the page itself.  For example

1. 2 open reviews -> OK
 2. 2 closed reviews - > OK
 3. 1 open review and 1 closed review -> Only lists the 1 open review

Granted when you click on that link the popup window will show you all the review and their states correctly.  The problem is that the the development panel within JIRA is limiting what information it provides here.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if you could see the total number of reviews, and all the states/status of them without having to click on the review link.
h3. Why this is important

A related bug, -JSW-13607-, touched on this behavior, but was ultimately closed as 'cannot reproduce'.   However from reading a comment from Matthew Watson, it makes it seem like this particular aspect (the total issues listed in the panel) is by design:
{quote}Also note that the count on the development panel is not the total count, it is only the count of reviews/pull-requests/builds that are in a given state (open/merged/failing/ etc.)
{quote}
Quoted comment from -JSW-13607-

 

!developmentpanel1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Development panel for Crucible review should show total

fields.description: JIRA sprint health gadget converts the estimation from hours to days, weeks, mouths, etc. Although the configuration of the instance is set to hours (in time tracking settings), the gadget always converts the time. Would be useful that the gadget follows the configuration os the instance.
fields.summary: Sprint health gadget estimation on hours

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, issues that are not estimated can be added to sprints regardless. When these are added and users change the estimation during sprints, scope gets changed and it also affects charts that are generated for each sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Restrict issues being added to sprint if they are not estimated.

h3. Why this is important
It would ensure that scope changes are minimal and agile reports would reflect the sprint better.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Restrict issues from being added to sprint if unestimated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The custom field of type Select List (multiple choices) requires the customer to add options available to chose. The customer would want this filed to be auto populated. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to auto populate a custom field based on a condition
fields.summary: Auto populate custom field values based on condition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
From the Agile board there's no way to immediately tell if an issue has linked issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
We propose that you provide a way to color these cards to signify that they are linked to another issue.

h3. Why this is important
You can find any related issues at quick glance rather than having to open each card.
fields.summary: Card colors based on linked issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15372].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Sprint Health Gadget doesn't show the correct number of flagged issues 

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Sprint 
# Add Flag to some issues 
# Configure the dashboard Sprint Health Gadget to show the Board where this Sprint is Active

h3. Expected Results
Show the correct number of flagged issues in the Sprint

h3. Actual Results
Wrong number of flagged issues is shown


h3.Workaround
no workaround available
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget shows wrong number of flagged issues
Disable opportunity of customer to view all users in autocomplete form on different fields and restrict opportunity of customer to view profile of other users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 6, clicking on a Fix Version of an issue will lead users to an overview of that version (Releases page). 
!6.png|thumbnail!

However, in JIRA 7, clicking on a Fix Version will lead users to the Issue Navigator, automatically searching for all issues with that same fix version
!7.png|thumbnail!

This is intended behaviour as explained in [JRA-44916|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44916]. However, some users actually want to see the overview of the version instead since there is always the option to *View in Issue Navigator*

h3. Suggestion
Give an option to the admin/users to either redirect to the Releases page or the Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Fix Versions on the View Issue page redirect to an issue navigator search

fields.summary: JIRA Should not redirecte to Bitbucket when creating a branch

fields.description: Make it possible to use a swimlane in a kanban board to change or update a field in an issue? For instance I could configure a board so that it has swimlanes based on priority, or assignee, or team so that if I dragged the issue from one swimlane to another it would create, update, change or delete a value or attribute in an issue field?
fields.summary: Change field property based on swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint Health Gadget auto-generated incorrect query
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sprint
 # Add two different components on the project (at this example we'll be using: "Team Enigma" and "Team Green Bay Packers")
 # Go to the board of the project and create a new filter using the following JQL: project = YOUR PROJECT AND component = "Team Enigma" ORDER BY component ASC, Rank ASC
 # After changing the board filter, we'll only see issues with Componenet/s = "Team Enigma"
 # Go back to JIRA main page and add the gadget "Sprint Health Gadget"
 # Click in the "In progress" issues and then click on "View issue in Navigator"
 # At the issue navigator, instead of using the JQL setup at step #3 (project = YOUR PROJECT AND component = "Team Enigma" ORDER BY component ASC, Rank ASC) the JQL is being replaced by: status in ("In Progress") AND Sprint = 52
 Showing some issues that are not supposed to be shown here like issues with component = "Team Green Bay Packers"

h3. Expected Results

Show only issues that has component = "Team Enigma"
h3. Actual Results

We're getting results from both components ("Team Enigma" and "Team Green Bay Packers")
  
h3. Notes

Attached a sample video to demonstrate the issue

[^Sprint.mp4]
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget auto-generated incorrect query

fields.description: We used to be able to right click on an issue from a board and open the issue in a new browser window or tab. Now we have to click on the issue to open it in the right hand pane and then click again to open it. Can this old functionality be added to the new UI? The right hand pane is not especially user friendly and we much prefer having several issues open at once.
fields.summary: Right click to open issues in a new window/tab

fields.description:
We would like to able to sort and filter releases in the release page by most of the columns present there (version, start date, release date). As an MVP, sorting by release date would go a long way!

!2016-12-21_1135.png|width=585,height=191!
fields.summary: Sort and Filter in Releases page

fields.description:
It will be great if we have feature that the newly created repository added automatically in DVCS  account in JIRA. 

Currently, we need to refresh repositories in the JIRA DVCS account, so that the new repository will be added.
fields.summary: Adding new repository should automatically added to JIRA DVCS account without refreshing the DVCS account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
If a board's filter query is changed so that it shows issues from a different project, and that new project's workflow does not contain the statuses set up in the board configuration, they will not be usable. This is a problem for any user who wants to set up a board ONCE, and copy it to use it for other projects without having to do much extra work.

h3. Suggestion Solutions:
1. When a board has statuses that do not belong to the project it is showing issues from, provide a button along the lines of "Add these statuses to the project [Project Name]" to quickly add all missing statuses to that project's workflow. The user can already do this one status at a time with the "Add Status" button, so this new button would simply automate that process.

2. When a board has statuses that do not belong to the project it is showing issues from, provide a button on each status that does not belong (And therefore has a yellow exclamation mark symbol) which lets the user quickly add that status to the project it is missing from.

3. Allow the user to assign a different workflow to a board, WITHOUT turning off the "Simplified Workflow" features. This way the user can set up ONE workflow, point all of their boards at it, and they'll all have the same statuses available, but they can also carry on adding statuses/columns simply. This will, of course, add those same statuses to all the linked boards, so a warning will need to be shown to this effect.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Software boards Columns usability when changing the filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As a user, I'd like to have a configuration which allows me to set the default column constraint globally so that I don't have to do it for every board.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide Global column constraint configuration
fields.summary: Provide Global column constraint configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Board Filters can end up with invalid JQL syntax when the underlying data of the query is modified or removed. e.g. a component that is referenced gets removed or renamed, an issue key that is referenced is deleted, etc etc.

 

Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your project board
 # Choose *Board* > *Configure* > *Filters*
 # Edit or Create a Filter with a valid query and Save.
 # The Board will display data as expected
 # Invalidate the query created in Step 3 *by modifying some meta data in JIRA that is referenced in the query*
 # This will error out in the issue navigator where the query is validated before execution
 # since the query was valid when it was saved; it stays set in the Board Config. 
 # When you access the Board - no Data is Displayed

h3. Expected Results

There should be an error on the Board saying the underlying query in INVALID.
h3. Actual Results

The Board displays no data without any errors or warnings.
fields.summary: Board Filters can end up with invalid JQL when underlying data used in the query are deleted or modified

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the [Velocity Chart documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER072/Velocity+Chart] is not explicit with regards to the fact that sub-task's Original Time Estimate are not used in calculating the velocity per sprint. The lack of this information can cause confusion, which can explain the creation of the following feature request and bug report:
* [JSW-15302 : Allow option for Velocity Chart to include sub-task estimates|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15302]
* [JSW-9164 : Sub-task hours estimate not reflected in planning and reports|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-9164]

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify the Velocity Chart documentation with the explicit fact that sub-task's estimates are not part of the velocity calculation, perhaps along with an explanation of the logic and implementation as well.
fields.summary: Improve Velocity Chart documentation with regards to sub-task estimates

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently when completing a Sprint that has many (Tested with 350 and 184) uncompleted issues, and choose to move the uncompleted issues to a future Sprint, the issues are first moved to *Backlog* and after about 30 seconds are moved to the selected Sprint.

In clean instances, we were able to reproduce this with 3500 issues.

This might confuse the customers that the issues are moved to Backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board and 2 sprints
# Create 3500 issues in one sprint
# Start and complete sprint (keep all issues open)
# Select option to move issues to the other sprint.

h3. Expected Results

All issues are processed and moved to the other sprint.

h3. Actual Results
Operation times out and we get this error:
!Sprint timeout.png|thumbnail! 

Only part of the issues are moved to the other sprint.

h3. Notes
We can see different number of issues causing this problem depending on the issues. Simple issues on clean instance on new projects seem to require 3500+ issues to cause this problem.

h3.Workaround
First bulk move some tickets to the other sprint and then complete it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve performance
fields.summary: Improve performance when moving issues to next Sprint contains many issues

fields.description: Provide a way to change the side which the items in the backlog appear on. For example, moving the issue key and priority to the left of the card. Please, see attached for reference.
fields.summary: Ability to reorder backlog items

fields.description:
Description:

When I'm opening the JIRA task I usually don't notice that on the bottom is an comment (you have to scroll the task to bottom to notice that, look at the screen attached).

So usually developers, testers pay most attention to task description and attachment and later they discover there is a comment. 

 

As a use I would like to have some icon, indicator, or jump to link, that will inform me about comment on the bottom when I open task on desktop screen. 

 

Thank you for your time :)
fields.summary: don't miss comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is a new change in layout of the board and it's not updated in the documentation yet.
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15331
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/what-is-a-board-764477964.html#Whatisaboard?-issuedetailviewUsingtheissuedetailview
fields.summary: Update "What is a board?" documentation

fields.description:
after attached an attachment to issue, it would be very handy if JIRA can support auto-complete when input [^...  (for attachment) like it support for @name. 

please consider.
fields.summary: auto-complete for attachment

fields.description:
A recently JIRA upgrade has changed the default views for project sprint board. Atlassian has given the issue cards a facelift where user can get the needed info without the clutter.

Customers are suggesting to enable a way to see the old layout as well, specially that ones using display resolutions below 1080p.
fields.summary: Ability to view old card layout in Agile boards

- after the last update from JIRA the issues on the dashboard are too slim , it does not work on a small screen, I can not read the name of the issue.
- and Before the las update there was the indentificator of the issue was a link, now it's not and that makes more difficult to access the issue directly.(was better before).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Subtask section in a Story does not show the issue key of a subtask
*  !Subtask section under Story.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the issue key of a subtask in the Subtask section in a Story
fields.summary: Show subtask issue key in Subtask section in a Story

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Right now we don't have any notification when a JIRA Issue is added to a Bamboo Build.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a notification from JIRA (or Bamboo) when an Issue is linked to a Build.
fields.summary: Notify when Jira issue added to Build

fields.description: I'm trying to leave my Kanban Board with collapse all swimlanes, Bug, new function and others. But I can not be disabled.
fields.summary: collapse all swimlanes

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a version in a project with a really long name.
# Create a Sprint
# Add this version to a ticket and set this version to the ticket
# Complete the sprint with this issue
# Do this for another, different version
# Go into the Version Report page

h3. Current Behaviour

There is no way to see the entire Version name on that page.

h3. Suggestion

Make it so that hovering over the version name it displays the whole name.
fields.summary: Ability to see full version name on the Version Report when long

fields.description:
Hello,

In the label displaying the number of issues in a sprint, the french translation when there are several issues should be "demandes" as in "13 demandes" (for "13 issues"), instead of "demande" (which is the singular).

The translation for the number of issues in the backlog is correct (it's "demandes").

Would it be possible to change this translation ?
I know it's stupid but it really bothers me to see several times a day ;)

Thank you

\\

EDIT : I don't seem to be able to contribute a translation directly in Atlassian Translations (maybe I just didn't find the way to do it) but searching through translations I think the involved label key is _gh.boards.issues2_ 

\\

EDIT 2 : It took me a while but I finally saw the "Retranslate" link ;) This issue can be closed and I hope my translation proposal will be accepted soon.
fields.summary: [FR Translation] Wrong translation for "issue" plural in French in some case

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are many requests to have "Pull Request Approved" trigger in our workflow. It will be great if we can implement it and put it in our road map.
fields.summary: It will be great to have "Pull Request Approved" trigger in JIRA workflow

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The logging for com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess is rather vague, and could create confusion and unnecessary worries towards JIRA administrators seeing this error is thrown in the logs for a valid use case such as : [JSW-15307|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15307]

h3. Suggested Solution
To show exact configuration that is hitting the nullpointer exception here
fields.summary: To improve the logging for com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess

fields.description:
When adding tests to a test cycle from other cycles there are only 4 execution statuses allowed to select at the moment. 

It would be great to have the option to add "unexecuted" tests from other cycles.

 

Kind regards

Julian
fields.summary: Allow adding "unexecuted" tests to a test cycle

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Velocity Chart does not consider sub-task estimates in it's calculations. Users would like the flexibility to choose whether to include sub-task estimates for this chart so that it utilizes the sum of the Original Estimate for both the parent issue and it's sub-tasks, rather than just the Original Estimate for the parent issue. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for flexibility by implementing a option which allows users to decide whether to include sub-task estimates in the parent estimate for Velocity calculations. 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Allow option for Velocity Chart to include sub-task estimates

fields.description:
It is getting more and more common these days to size EPICS in T-shirt size, where an Epic that looks like needing a full srpint to get done, would be a "M", 2 Sprints an "L" and so on.

This has an enormous value for project prospection, sales estimates, and backlog management (it is great to be able to know how long your backlog before creating and sizing stories.

We would like to have this as a system field, that we can use for EPICs, and not a custom field we create and that will generate custom formatted data, hard to manage down the road for add-ons, or JIRA upgrades. 

More info here:

[https://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/estimating-with-tee-shirt-sizes] 

https://www.sitepoint.com/3-powerful-estimation-techniques-for-agile-teams/
fields.summary: T Shirt Size field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing an issue, the issue dropdown for Linked issues doesn't show available options other than history

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue 
# Click *Edit*
# Start typing under Linked issue (example blocks), Issue 
#*  !Edit issue link.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
Show available issues other then searched in History 

h3. Actual Results
Only issues searched in history are shown
 

h3.Workaround
# Go to issue
# Click *3 dots* > *Link*
# Start typing the issue key
#*  !Link issue.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When editing an issue, the issue dropdown for Linked issues doesn't show available options other than history

fields.description:
Hi,

as far as I know there is no way to query issues raised during a certain sprint.

the use case would be to list all bugs that were raised (but not necessarily fixed) during a certain sprint. the only way to do this now would be to know the start and end date of the specific sprint and then search for issues created during that time period. Since JIRA should know the start and end date of any sprint it should be possible to simplify this by just quering issues raised during sprint xy
fields.summary: search for issues raised during a sprint

fields.description: Can you give us a keyboard shortcut to link issue? It would be very handy
fields.summary: Shortcut to link issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Starting in JIRA 7.2.0, the issue detail view in boards became editable, per [JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes].

When editing a Story points field, such as Estimate, changes are not confirmed unless the user explicitly uses the Enter key on the keyboard, or clicks the checkmark button. Other fields in JIRA, including other editable fields in the Board Issue Detail View and in the regular JIRA Issue view, confirm changes once the user clicks away from the field, changing focus. 

When the user does edit the Estimate field and clicks any whitespace on the page, the field remains in edit mode. This does not happen with the other editable fields, such as Labels.
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Change the behavior of the Estimate field so that changing focus away from the field automatically confirms the change. This is to keep it in line with already existing behavior for other fields.

h3. Why this is important
 
While this behavior remains inconsistent, users may expect their changes to be committed once focus is changed, and may inadvertently switch to a different issue thinking the change was saved. 

h3. Workaround 

Explicitly confirm the change using Enter key or by clicking the check button before switching to any other issues or screens.
fields.summary: Make editing Story Points/Estimate in Board Issue Detail View more consistent with the rest of JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15282].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Starting in JIRA 7.2.0, the issue detail view in boards became editable, per [JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes].

When story points are being edited in this issue detail view, a info bubble with the text "Story Points" appears, which ends up appearing right on top of where the confirm check button is. While the bubble is present, you cannot click on the confirm check button (also where it overlaps with the cancel check button, the same thing will happen there). Moving the mouse will cause this to rapidly flash in and out of the screen, interfering with the user's ability to click either of these boxes.

Better visualized:
 [^Story_Points.mp4] 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.0 - JIRA 7.2.3
Firefox 49.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Ensure that Story Points are visible in the screens for the project(s) the board is configured with to ensure that the field will be editable
2. Click the Estimate to try to edit the value inside
3. Note the Story Points bubble popping up

h3. Expected Results

The bubble should not be showing when trying to click the button. The other fields that are editable on this screen all show a different bubble, "Press Alt+s to submit this form", and the bubble doesn't overlap with the buttons.

h3. Actual Results

The bubble pops up, interfering with the buttons.
 
h3. Notes

The severity of this behavior appears to be environment specific. I found that my success rate for clicking the button and avoiding the bubble was very high, but other environments may find that the bubble persists longer, appears more frequency, etc..

h3.Workaround

Confirm your edit using the Enter key on your keyboard instead of clicking the button.
fields.summary: Story Points info bubble on JIRA Software Cloud interferes with confirmation check button in board's issue detail view

fields.description:
When subtasks are configured for time tracking and the parent is not configured for time tracking, if you add the parent issue to a sprint without an original estimate added you get an error 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Create a parent issue without time tracking fields present
2.  Create a subtask and do not input time into the Original Estimate field
3.  Add the parent issue to a Sprint

When you follow these steps you get an error that states the scope will change.

Suggestion:

The warning should be more verbose as to what the issue is so it can be corrected or the admin should be allowed to edit the error message to relieve end user confusion.
fields.summary: Improve scope change warning when parent issue not configured for time-tracking

fields.description:
When the user selects "hide menu", then he's stuck. It's not possible the show the menu back.

 

Fix => close the webbrowser and than logout and login again
fields.summary: When user select "hide menu", the user can't revert this without logging out

fields.description: Would be useful if the default board from the business projects could possible set as a default board for the customer.
fields.summary: Allow an Agile board referencing a business project to be set as a default board
Version Report has unpredictable calculation

fields.description:
As a JIRA administrator,

I'd like to be able to disable the creation of new statuses by standard users through the Simplified Workflow's 'Add Status' button

so that I can:
 * avoid the creation of effectively duplicated status names like "To Do" & "TODO", or Testing & Test & Tested & In Test & Integration Test
 * make easier multi-project JQL queries to retrieve meaningful info based on statuses
 * make more maintainable the order in which statuses are displayed in gadgets and JQL ORDER BY clause.
 * avoid the creation of statuses for trying to store info when it would be better to use anything else instead (labels, the resolution field, a custom field...)
fields.summary: Simplified Workflow: add option to disable the creation of new statuses

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, when dragging/dropping stories to versions and epics, the Detail View keeps on popping up, stealing screen real estate.

I'd like to have an checkbox to disable the Detail View per Agile Board (Kanban + Scrum).
fields.summary: Add "Disable Detail View" option to Agile Board admin pane

fields.description:
Our company uses SAFe and a rolling wave plan.  The teams are responsible for six sprints of groomed backlog.  Currently Sprint planning is cumbersome due to having to scroll from the backlog up through several planned sprints to move stories around and see the story point totals per sprint. 

It would be convenient if there was a toggle to enable a pane similar to the version and Epics pane when there are more than a couple of future sprints created.  This would allow teams to conveniently see how many story points are allocated and drag stories directly from the backlog to sprints in the same fashion as versions and Epics.  

I am attaching a screenshot to give you a visual of how it would allow teams to create kind of a sprint planning workspace and streamline the planning meetings.
fields.summary: create a future sprints pane on the agile board backlog view

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have an option to hide boards from the project main page.

For this specific customer case, there is a board where he uses it just for general view and he don't want to show this board on the board list when opening the project main page.
fields.summary: Option to hide a board from the project main page.

fields.description:
h2.Summary

When the parallel sprint is disabled from *JIRA Software Configuration*, some of the 'Start Sprint' button on the backlog disappears.

h2.Step to Replicate
# Create a few JIRA tickets and then assign them to 3 sprints.
# Start the 1st sprint.
# Disable parallel sprint in *JIRA Software Configuration*
# Go back to the backlog, the button will be missing.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h2.Expected Result
A gray out 'Start Sprint' button should be shown.

h2.Current Result
'Start Sprint' button is missing.
fields.summary: 'Start Sprint' button goes missing when parallel sprint is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in Jira there is an option to search for future Sprints by name, however the customer would want to have ability to search for next Sprints

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to query for something like: 
{code}
project = "XXX" Sprint in ("nextSprint() + 2")
{code}

 
h3. Workaround 
Search for issues in future Sprint by name
fields.summary: JQL - Ability to search for next future sprints

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, when the board is configured with swinlane, the issues that match multiple swimlane will only be shown in the first swinlane they match. 

For example:
Swimlane: Queries
Q1: labels = A
Q2: labels = B

For issue X that has label: A and B, this will only be shown under Q1 swimlane, and not in Q2 swimlane. This limit the full view for the user to see the issues with label = B. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option where issues that match multiple swimlanes are shown in multiple swimlane.
fields.summary: Having the option to show issues in multiple swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is a crucial information missing in [Migrating JIRA applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-802592269.html] around different server timezone. Having different time zone between the source server and target server can break Agile reports due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-5433

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a colored warning in the particular document and related document stating something similar to
{quote}
(!) Migrating to another server that has different timezone can break JIRA Software reporting. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-5433
{quote}

h3. Why this is important
It breaks JIRA Software reporting that is being used by Agile users. Representation of issues that are closed in a Sprint can vary.
 
h3. Workaround 
To re-run the XML restore that can take hours to complete, the full steps are explained in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-5433
fields.summary: Update Upgrade Documentation to WARN on Timezone

fields.description:
Hi JIRA Team,

We have started using the Kanban board for our team but we noticed that the tickets continue to stay in the Done column forever. In order to mitigate this issue we implemented the following board filter which works great in clearing out the Board from issues which were released:
{code:java}
project in (<redacted>) AND (status != Done AND (fixVersion is EMPTY OR fixVersion != "Unreleasable Work")) OR (status = Done and fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() and fixVersion != "Unreleasable Work") ORDER BY Rank ASC, STATUS ASC

{code}
However, after we implemented this filter, I noticed that the Control Chart gets wiped with every release. I am assuming this is because the Control Chart uses the current state of the board filter and not keeping track of the boards history. Would it be possible to start storing the Control Chart data in a way which would take historical states into consideration? 

 

Alternatively, is there an alternative way for me to hide tickets from appearing in the Done column indefinitely and keep the Control Chart in-tact?

 

Thanks in advance for your response!
fields.summary: Add historic awareness to Control Chart

fields.description:
At present, the only way to delete a repository from the DVCS connector is to delete the entire organisation it belongs to. For customers using a single organisation where not all repos are (or should) be used, this can potentially result in a lot of redundant data in the DB.

When a user clicks the 'x' in the UI for a repository today, it is "unlinked". Unlinked repositories still synchronise data in the background (see [SIN-236|https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/SIN-236] for proposed changes to that).

The DVCS connector should be updated to allow an admin to list all the "unlinked" repositories, and "really delete" the data for those.
fields.summary: Ability to delete a single repository

fields.description:
At present, as soon as a repository is linked, a series of synchronisation tasks will be queued for that repository. These tasks will be processed indiscriminately until such time as that repo's data is completely sync'd with JIRA.

This can yield problems like in [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-49709], where there are some expensive repos that were unlinked some time ago that are still generating synchronisation tasks.

If a repository is actively synchronising while an admin unlinks the repository, all future synchronisation tasks for that repository should be paused until such time as the repository is re-linked.

This will serve two purposes:
 * help alleviate potentially expensive work that's blocking active repositories
 * give admins a sort of "soft killswitch" for stopping synchronisation tasks (today, they need to delete the entire organisation to stop a repo from syncing)
fields.summary: Synchronisation tasks should be paused or de-prioritised when unlinked

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If an admin synchronises dozens of repositories at a time, the messages table can fill up with hundreds of, if not thousands of entries for processing commits from a repository.

At the moment, whether the system is actively processing any repository information is a bit of a black box.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if the UI could inform the admin on the amount of work the DVCS connector is processing. This would help both admins and Atlassian Support triage problems with the connector where the system is so overloaded with work that the plugin appears to be doing nothing.
fields.summary: Indicate queue size for synchronisation tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a customer has a large number of repositories, or one significantly large repository with many branches, the messages table fills up with a lot of sync tasks for that repo. Other repositories' sync tasks can get pushed back as a result.

When a repo begins synchronisation, the UI is updated with a spinner and a message that implies the synchronisation is immediately processed.

In reality, that repo may not be actively synchronised for a little while.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be fantastic if the UI could inform when a synchronisation is queued versus actively being processed.

Achieving this may require adjusting of how a repository is considered to be syncing, which may involve database-level changes (since I think it assumes a sync is actively being processed if there's an entry in the audit log table with no end date).
fields.summary: Differentiate between repo syncs that are actively being processed versus queued

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue links in board's issue detail view does not work

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.2.4
* JIRA Software 7.2.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two issues in any JIRA Software project
# Create an issue link between the two issues
# Access the issue detail view via a Project board
# Click on the issue link

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on the issue link should open the linked issue

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens
 
h3. Notes
The link works in normal JIRA issue detail view, but not in JIRA Software board's issue detail view.

h3.Workaround
Right click at the issue link and click *Open*
fields.summary: Issue links in board's issue detail view does not work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As a user, I'd like to have a custom Rank field for each board so that any changes (re-prioritizing) made in one board, won't affect another.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to have Rank field for each/specific board.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to have Rank field for each board

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The JIRA Software REST API docs (both [Cloud|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/] and [Server|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/server/]) currently have this text in the introduction:

\{quote}
 * There are two API names available: {{auth}} for authentication-related operations and {{api}} for everything else. These are discussed further below.

\{quote}

This is incorrect. There is only one API name for the JSW REST API, which is "agile". 
h3. Task
 # Double-check that the 'auth' and 'api' API names are invalid for the JSW REST API docs.
 # Update the JSW REST API docs for Cloud and Server accordingly.
fields.summary: JIRA Software REST API docs list incorrect API names

fields.description: This Suggestion is a request for Kanban Backlog (KanPlan) to be available for JIRA Software Server. The feature graduated from Labs in JIRA Software Cloud and is generally available.
fields.summary: Kanban Backlog (Kanplan) for JIRA Software Server

fields.description:
h3. h3. Summary

Old smart commits still shown after project key changed
h3. h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Perform the normal smart commit that includes JIRA Issue Key together in the commits.
 # Changed the Project Key after that.
 # Perform smart commit again with the new JIRA Issue Key

h3. h3. Expected result
 * The old smart commits should not be appeared in the JIRA Issue anymore.

h3. h3. Actual result
 * The old smart commits still appear

h3. h3. Workaround

No workaround for now
fields.summary: Old commits still shown after project key changed
Epics created in boards name and summary do not link to name and description in issues

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I want to know the velocity we actually achieved, even if a story that wasn't completed has its points value changed.

At present, a historical sprint report is affected by any later point changes which means you can't trust historic sprint reports for real achieved vs non-achieved points:
 * Instead after a sprint is closed, the values in the sprint report should become immutable (or have a separate function for manual editing if needed)
 * This could then be used in roadmapping tools like Portfolio to dynamically generate predicted velocity based on actual historical data
fields.summary: After closing a sprint, all story point values in the report should be locked - even if values are changed on issues themsleves

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Before JIRA 7 or JIRA 6 with the *Project Navigation* disabled, browsing any Versions from the *Release* page is very convenient with the navigation panel available on the top right side of the page. User can browse the previous version or next version easily with the navigation panel.
 !navigation.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Embed the same navigation panel back to the Release for Versions page
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to use the navigation buttons on the Release for Versions page to browse the previous or next Version

fields.description:
Change the title of the JIRA Software REST API docs so that they specifically mention Cloud or Server:

[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/]

[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/server/]

Also, 
* update the intro to provide links between cloud and server docs, 
* for server doc, provide links to older versions
fields.summary: Update title and intro of JSW REST API docs to better distinguish between Cloud and Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when using text searching in the Quick Searching box, if the text custom field contains a number, jira doesn't list it in the results. Instead it searches for an Issue key with this number in the last browsed project. 

*Example:* The text custom field value contains 12345. Jira searches for IN-12345 (IN being the last project browsed).

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have both, search for the issue key as well as for the text in the custom field
 
h3. Workaround 
Enter the number as a wildcard instead. *Example:* 12345*
fields.summary: Text searching in Quick Searching box should also find numbers in a text custom field

fields.description:
Hi,

  We have a JIRA instance ( [https://issues.jenkins-ci.org|https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/] ) where we tried to use the DVCS integration but sadly we had to stop it because it was consuming too many GitHub's APIs calls and thus we were hitting the rate limit.

  On JIRA side we have a project with 35k issues and on Github side we have more than 1500 repositories. We understand that we are probably touching a limitation and there are few JIRA users with such configuration but maybe you could allow to configure some caches or to configure the refresh rate to avoid such issue. We would prefer to have our DVCS info less up-to-date than none of them.

See also:
 * [http://lists.jenkins-ci.org/pipermail/jenkins-infra/2016-October/000893.html]
 * [http://lists.jenkins-ci.org/pipermail/jenkins-infra/2016-November/000960.html]
 * [https://twitter.com/aheritier/status/798583730730369025]

Best regards
fields.summary: DVCS integration for GitHub consumes too many requests
Add futureSprint() function in the documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15214].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Importing from JIRA cloud to JIRA server 7.2.4 fails with error 'JIRA software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed'. 
h3. Environment

JIRA Server 7.2.X

JIRA Cloud 1000.555.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Get backup of cloud instance
 2. Install latest version of jira 7.2.4
 3. Run XML import which completes without error
h3. Expected Results

JIRA Software to work.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA Software is not available. Restart/reinstall is not helping.
h3. Workaround

Set or add a property "GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version" with value 51.
h3. Notes

The root cause is that Cloud export is missing GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version property which is required by Server. Maybe we are missing a downgrade task that should set the property to 51 which is the last SAL build number.

 

The symptoms are the same as in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-47764 but probably the root causes are different.
fields.summary: JIRA Software not working after Cloud to Server import
Unable to boards, backlogs, projects, etc.
Swimlane configuration only shows one project
Swimlane configuration only shows one project

fields.description:
Go to board and configure swimlanes as Epic.

Go back to work mode and try toggle swimlanes visibility. You will see the focus in proper way.

Try with Tab button and Space button that does not help to toggle swimlanes.

Affect version : JIRA Agile v1000.108.1
fields.summary: Focusing on Swimlanes does not show properly

fields.description: As a PM, I want to avoid having to manually copy/paste each AWS Device Farm errors for different devices into JIRA bug tickets, so that I can avoid hanging myself in two months' time.
fields.summary: AWS Device Farm Integration
